about: Automobile Engineering is a branch of engineering that focuses on the design, development, manufacturing, and maintenance of automobiles. It integrates elements of mechanical, electrical, electronic, software, and safety engineering to create efficient and high-performance vehicles. Automobile engineers work on various aspects, including vehicle aerodynamics, powertrain systems, fuel efficiency, safety features, and advanced technologies such as electric and autonomous vehicles. With the rapid advancements in automotive technology, the field is evolving towards sustainability, incorporating hybrid and electric powertrains to reduce carbon emissions. As the demand for smart and connected vehicles increases, automobile engineering continues to drive innovation in transportation, enhancing performance, safety, and environmental impact.
vision: To be a centre of excellence for dissemination of knowledge in Physics and to promote innovation for academic and professional success for the welfare of the nation and beyond.
mission: The Department of Physics is committed to provide adequate knowledge in physics for engineering students through an effective teaching-learning process, to mould them into competent professionals ready to meet global challenges and to promote research activities by nurturing the spirit of innovation among students and members of faculty by providing state-of-the-art facilities in the new areas of science and technology.
objective: The Department aims to disseminate knowledge and skill based understanding of the concepts of science, especially in areas relevant to Engineering and Technology. The research centre in the department provides an active and dynamic research atmosphere where research on futuristic areas in physics is pursued.
